items.title: Rising unemployment keeps a Fed cut alive #shorts #fed #bloombergbrief
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
US November jobs report: Hiring rebounds, but rising unemployment keeps a Fed cut alive. Manus Cranny reports. 

Tune into "Bloomberg Brief" weekdays at 5 a.m. ET https://trib.al/278omIP

items.title: Fed's Goolsbee Says Labor Market Stable, Lower Rates Ahead
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee says the labor market appears largely stable and expects rates will be “a fair bit lower” a year from now. Goolsbee speaks during a fireside chat as part of the Chicago Fed's Annual Economic Outlook Symposium.

Sign up for the Economics Daily newsletter to discover what's driving the global economy and what it means for policy makers, businesses, investors and you: https://bloom.bg/4535pfS

items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. Click here to subscribe to the free daily Surveillance newsletter - https://www.bloomberg.com/account/newsletters/surveillance

items.title: The calculation of ever-increasing hurricane risk #shorts #insurance #wallstreetweek #hurricane
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: 2024 was the third costliest hurricane season in US history, and ever-increasing risks are driving up insurance costs. Watch "Wall Street Week" with David Westin Fridays at 6 p.m. ET https://trib.al/vvFkzLW

items.title: Hiring Rebounds, But US Jobless Rate Ticks Up | Bloomberg Surveillance | December 6, 2024
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Bloomberg Surveillance hosted by Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney
December 6, 2024

Featuring:
•  Claudia Sahm, Chief Economist at New Century Advisors, Sarah Wolfe, Senior Economist at Morgan Stanley, Kathy Jones, Chief Fixed Income Strategist at Charles Schwab, and Lori Calvasina, Head of US Equity Strategy at RBC Capital Markets, break down the November nonfarm payrolls report
•  Alan S. Blinder, professor of economics at Princeton University and former Federal Reserve Vice Chairman, reacts to the latest jobs report and offers his take on America's socioeconomic path under the incoming Trump administration 
•  Stephen Carroll, host of Daybreak Europe on Bloomberg Radio, reports on French President Emmanuel Macron's efforts to form a new government after Prime Minister Michel Barnier was ousted in a no-confidence vote

Get the Bloomberg Surveillance newsletter, delivered every weekday.
Sign up now: https://www.bloomberg.com/account/newsletters/surveillance

items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:

items.title: South Korean Troops Enter National Assembly During Martial Law
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
South Korea's National Assembly Secretariat releases CCTV footage showing military forces entering the legislative compound after President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law on Dec. 3. Helicopters carrying troops were seen landing at the complex and soldiers appear to attempt smashing windows to enter the building. Source: National Assembly Secretariat handout.
--------

items.title: South Korea's Shock Martial Law, What It means for the Economy | Big Take
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
South Korea’s President Yoon shocked the world when he first imposed, then lifted, martial law this week. On this episode of the Big Take Asia podcast, Bloomberg's Sam Kim and K. Oanh Ha discuss how the chaos unfolded and what it means for the country’s future. Listen to the full episode wherever you get your podcasts https://trib.al/jvUgWVV

#politics #asia #korea #southkorea #podcast

items.title: Fed's Daly Sides With 'Gradualism Approach' to Rates
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly says she is a proponent of a more gradual approach to monetary policy adjustment. She speaks during a conversation on emerging technology and the economy at Stanford University’s Hoover Institution.

items.title: How Elon Musk's support for #Trump is impacting #Tesla sales #podcast
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
On this episode of the Elon, Inc. podcast, we discuss how Musk's political views are affecting his customer base. Listen to the full episode wherever you get your podcasts https://trib.al/kJ7ZTrU

#tech #technology #politics 

Each week, listen in as host David Papadopoulos convenes a panel of Bloomberg Businessweek journalists who are tracking Musk’s companies and the surprising ways they intersect. They break down the business mogul's latest moves and analyze what they could mean for us all.

items.title: TikTok faces US ban after appeals court refuses to block law #tiktok #shorts #tiktokban
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: Using TikTok? The app's Chinese parent company faces a ban in the US next month as a result of a federal appeals court ruling Friday. Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde tells us what could come next https://trib.al/sI7nKeJ

items.title: Here's why the #UK stock market is shrinking #shorts
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: Takeovers of London-listed companies are shrinking the UK stock market at the fastest pace in more than a decade. Ben Scent explains https://bloom.bg/3ZGeslS

items.title: We shouldn't care about the trade balance, says expert #shorts #trade #wallstreetweek
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: "We shouldn't care about the trade balance." Mary Lovely of the Peterson Institute tells David Westin why countries should sometimes run trade deficits. Watch "Wall Street Week" Friday at 6 p.m. ET https://trib.al/rfCuxeQ
